name: Buttermilk Biscuits
description: Flaky, tender buttermilk biscuits with a golden crust, perfect for breakfast or as a side.

ingredients.item: 1 teaspoon salt plus extra for seasoning

items: Using a dough cutter cut a stick of butter lengthwise into thirds.
Turn the butter 90degrees and cut again into thirds.
Starting on one side, cut the butter into ½ slices.
Put butter into ramekin and keep in refrigerator until ready to use.

instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°. Convention if possible.
Pulse dry ingredients in food processor 2-3 times.
Pulse the flour in a food processor with the cold butter until the butter is the size of small pebbles approx 6-8 times.
Move food processor mixture into a large bowl.
Fold in the buttermilk using a spatula until mixed.
Dust a counter with the flour as well as your hands, the rolling pin and the dough cutter.
Transfer the dough to the counter and gently knead the dough until a rollable ball is created.
Roll the dough so it is ¾ inch high.
Cut the dough with a large floured biscuit cutter.
Knead scraps to make the final 2 biscuits.
Place the pieces 1½ inches apart on a lined sheet tray.
Rotate the sheet tray and bake for another 12 minutes.
Warm up honey in microwave for 20 seconds
Brush biscuits with honey and season with salt
